column4: someone who can help me thrue the configuration for an tv out geforce card ?
i just install the nvidia drivers.. and plug stuff in.. (some cards need the tv to be plugged in befor the sustem boots up) then use the nvidia-settings tool to enable the tv out
i normally use twinview and hae the tv out screen for my videos.
the problem for me is that i dont get coloure on my tv
last i had that issue. it was a bad svideo cable or plug.
i know the wire works cuz i used it on windows before so
no idea then. check the forums perhaps.
the thing is that i dont know how to change the output to B-pal
also the guys in #mythbuntu may have encountered the issue befor.
ok i will test ifsomeone can help there
that is in the xorg.conf i recall.  I rember ages ago reading the nvidia driver docs at the nvidia web site.   they got a LARGE readme with lots of config settings mentioned.
ive only ever used ntsc.
did ya put in a --> Option "TVStandard" "NTSC-M"
somewhere in there?
im just reading the docs at --> http://http.download.nvidia.com/XFree86/Linux-x86/1.0-8174/README/32bit_html/appendix-h.html
golly.. :) reading the manual worked?
i enalbe twinview.. drag the player over.. and  play them
nope i just rewright to PAL-B
isent there an way so i can use clones then ?
yes..  check the nvidia-settings tool
ok well il be sitting and trying to figure that out now...
gksudo nvidia-settings a few clicks.. done. :)
